intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium rauzense subsp. gletschense, commonly known as the Gletschense hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other members of the Hieracium species.
